cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-southwest, forecast to curve west-northwest and approach the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, Louisiana
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central U.S. Gulf Coast from the Upper Texas Coast to the Florida Panhandle, with greatest threat along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible, 37% chance of sustained ≥34 kt (39 mph) with peak onset around Saturday; slight (7%) chance of ≥50 kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge 3–5 ft possible from the Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City, which includes the New Orleans area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches widespread with isolated totals up to 18 inches possible, leading to significant freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Urban and river flooding, possible levee overtopping, and navigation restrictions on the Mississippi River.
